reviewText: First things first i am huge naruto fan.I have seen all 220 episodes of naruto and 140 episodes of shippuden.This boxset contains episodes 64to77.Episodes 64 to 71 conclude the sora filler arc of the previous boxset.From 72 to episode 90 of shippuden contains the immortals arc.For those who dont know this is NOT a filler arc.This arc in my opinion is the greatest arc i have ever seen.This arc centers around the 2 akatuski members Hidan and kakuza.The immortals arc is brillant, unfortunatly this boxset finishes just as a major fight is about to begin.From episode 72 onwards shippuden is amazing and finally is as good as the original epiosodes of naruto.The only reason this gets a 4 is because only 5 episodes are originaly from masashi kashimotos manga.However you must watch these episodes to have a understanding of what happens in the next AMAZING boxset.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: Naruto Shippuden continues to amaze me and this box set proves it.  I recommended this product to all fans of Naruto and Naruto Shippuden.  Many surprises accompany this box set just like the others.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: Buy if you want to add to your Naruto collection and see Asuma Sensai in action fighting against the Akatsuki.

Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: Better then Box Set 5, this gets back to the main story after the arc, but as is becoming typical of these box sets leaves you hanging on a climatic edge.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: "Box Set 6" contains episodes 66 - 77, continuing and concluding what was started in the previous season box, shippuden's first filler story known as the Sora Arc. Midway however it goes back to the original canon material with one of the more solid stories in the whole Naruto franchise. If you are looking into this box set you are already knowledgeable in the Naruto story and this set episodes do not disappoint. The previous box, in my honest opinion is better appreciated as a set-up to the characters that will be promptly featured in this canon arc.By now you already know the standards for these box sets, dual language (English & Japanese), text-less Opening/Closing credits, Trailers and a behind the scene of the English production from Viz. I highly recommend this set, things are just starting to get good and it'll leave you wanting the seventh box which will continue the excellent story that just started in this one.
summary: Things are starting to get good...
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: Overall I give this product an "okay" rating. Now this isn't because of price or the fact it is filler episodes. What really lowered this rating was the state in which the product arrived in. If I didn't know better I would have said it was a used instead of a new product. To start the cover surrounding the DVD box was dented with minor indents. Also many of the inside tabs keeping the disks in place broke leading to 2 out of 3 of the disks having slight scratches. Thankfully all the episodes played.With all this in mind I do not believe Amazon.com was at fault since the shipment went MIA (missing in action) for almost a week due to a carrier mistake. I have a feeling this is how the item arrive a little worse for wear.
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six

reviewText: This set will have us see the end conclusion of the Sora/Naruto vengeance story arc that has us seeing some of the past history of another leaf village Ninja Asuma who has his own shadowy connection with Sora's past as well as the group protagonist in this story arc as well,  and yes while these are filler arc episodes they on whole were still entertaining to watch.  After this story-arc though we get back to the Naruto plot with the introduction of two Akatsuki on the hunt for the containers of the tailed beasts to fulfill their main objective causing Tsunade to send out leaf village ninjas to try and apprehend the Akatsuki duo and find out their ultimate objective.  The series continues to be entertaining and though it's a long running series most fans I feel will agree that it's worth watching,  with this story-arc plot with the two Akatsuki we'll see the emotional and personal abilities and determination of Team 10 grow as they face a great tragedy that will shake their foundation but also give them the will to overcome any obstacle to achieve their goal.  While we will have to wait for the next box set to see the conclusion of this second story-arc I think many will feel it's worth it...
summary: The Team 10/Hidan Kakuzu Story Arc Begins Now
Title: Naruto Shippuden: Set Six
